title.content: If Judith puts all of her shopping in one bag will it be strong enough?

clue1.content: Judith has a small brown cat that she likes to play with.

clue3.content: One day, just before it started to rain, Judith goes to Pete’s Pet shop to buy some cat food.

clue4.content: On the way to Pete’s Pet shop Judith passed Bob’s bakery and a train station.

clue5.content: When she got to Pete’s Pet shop there was a long queue at the checkout.

clue6.content: Judith buys 2 packs of chunky rabbit cat food.

clue7.content: There is a special offer this week, dog food tins are 500g for the price of 250g.

clue8.content: A pack of cat food costs £5.

clue9.content: Each pack of cat food has 4 tins.

clue10.content: The tins in the pack are very heavy. Each tin of cat food weighs 250g.

clue11.content: Finally, Judith gets to the front of the queue and pays with the money her mum gave her.

clue12.content: The shop has very thin plastic carrier bags.

clue14.content: She remembers that there are 1000 grams in a kilogramme
